titleStmt.title: The historical parts of the Old and New Testament, in verse With one hundred and twenty cuts, being the best use of poetry and sculpture.
The historical parts of the Old and New Testament, in verse With one hundred and twenty cuts, being the best use of poetry and sculpture.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Sam. Keble at the Great Turk's-Head, in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: With an additional title page, engraved: The history of the old & new Testament described in figures.

Structure is indeterminate. The leaves are [1] engraved title page, [2] letterpress title page, [3] preface, with verses 1 and 2 on verso, [4] plate (illustrations to verses 1 and 2). Letterpress & engraved leaves generally alternate. Beginning with verses 3 and 4, each letterpress leaf is individually signed B,C, .. 2I. (Leaf H is signed "I" on verso; next letterpress leaf is lacking in catalogued copy, but assumed to be K; the next is L.).

Apparently several editions exist. In this edition, last line of text on signature E reads: "And there their mighty Father they deplore."The last line of text on signature O reads: "And she in Boaz with surprizing kindness meets." Last line of text on signature 2E reads: "While to Cæsar he reserves, what Cæsar's is.
